Peru CKAN R Package Development Guidelines

Source: claude.md

You are situated inside of an R package source directory. The subdirectory R/ contains source files. The subdirectory tests/testthat/ contains corresponding tests. e.g. R/task.R is tested primarily in tests/testthat/test-task.R.

Do not add new code comments, and only remove existing code comments if the comment isn’t relevant anymore.

CRITICAL: Always add @export roxygen tags to user-facing functions and update NAMESPACE accordingly. Functions without @export are internal and won’t be available to users.

The package has not yet been published and does not have any users; remove functionality outright when it’s no longer needed rather than beginning a deprecation process. No need to worry about breaking changes.

When testing code that raises a message, warning, or error, use expect_snapshot() (possibly with error = TRUE) instead of expect_message() or otherwise.

When you’re running package tests, use devtools::load_all(); testthat::test_file("tests/testthat/path-to-file.R"). If you encounter namespacing issues, don’t delete tests that otherwise should work, and instead ask me what to do.

To get a sense for the style used to write and test code in this package, read R/*.R and tests/testthat/*.R, respectively. Notably, do not comment your code besides roxygen comments.

Package Purpose

This R package provides a comprehensive interface to Peru’s CKAN data portal (datosabiertos.gob.pe), enabling users to:

  1. Query and search the CKAN data portal
  2. Search datasets by categories, tags, format, and resource type
  3. Extract complete metadata for each dataset
  4. Download and load resources directly into R

Technical Context from Prior Work

CKAN API Details

  • Base endpoint: https://www.datosabiertos.gob.pe/api/3/action/
  • API version: CKAN v3
  • Available endpoints:
    • package_list - Returns all dataset names (works reliably)
    • package_show?id={dataset_id} - Returns complete metadata for a dataset
    • resource_show?id={resource_id} - Returns metadata for a specific resource
    • group_list - Returns organization/group data (283+ organizations available)
    • current_package_list_with_resources - HIGHLY EFFICIENT - Returns complete metadata AND resources in single call with pagination support
    • site_read - Check portal availability
  • Non-functional endpoints: package_search, tag_list, organization_list, tag_search, package_autocomplete are not available on Peru’s CKAN instance

Known Limitations and Workarounds

  1. Search functionality: Since package_search doesn’t work, implemented efficient workarounds:
    • ✅ current_package_list_with_resources - Single API call gets complete metadata + resources
    • ✅ Local filtering with regex patterns on all dataset fields
    • ✅ Organization-based filtering using group_list
    • ✅ Pagination support for large result sets
    • ✅ Structured tabular output for datasets and resources
  2. Tag search URLs: Direct web interface URLs follow this pattern:
    • https://datosabiertos.gob.pe/search/field_tags/{tag_name}-{tag_id}
  3. Performance considerations:
    • Package list can be cached (e.g., 1-hour TTL in session)
    • Metadata fetching should be limited to avoid overwhelming the API
    • Consider pagination strategies for large result sets

HTTP Client Recommendations

Based on prior experience: - Use httr2 for HTTP requests - Implement retry logic (e.g., 3 attempts with exponential backoff) - Set appropriate timeout (e.g., 30 seconds) - Use a custom User-Agent header - Handle JSON responses with structure: {"success": true, "result": {...}}

Resource Handling

  • Filter for specific formats (CSV, Excel, JSON, etc.)
  • Consider implementing smart loading based on file type
  • Handle different encodings and data formats appropriately

Package Architecture Considerations

When designing the package, consider:

  1. Modular design: Separate API interactions, data processing, and user-facing functions
  2. Caching strategy: Balance between performance and data freshness
  3. Error handling: Graceful degradation when API is unavailable
  4. Extensibility: Design to accommodate future CKAN API changes or additional features
  5. Interoperability: Ensure compatibility with tidyverse and data.table workflows

Testing Strategy

  • Mock API responses for unit tests
  • Include integration tests that can be skipped if portal is unavailable
  • Test edge cases like empty results, malformed data, API timeouts
  • Use snapshot tests for complex data structures

Documentation

  • Provide clear examples for common use cases
  • Document API limitations and workarounds
  • Use Quarto (.qmd) for vignettes and documentation instead of R Markdown (.Rmd)
  • Include vignettes showing real-world workflows
  • Maintain a NEWS.md file for changes

Remember: This package aims to provide general access to Peru’s open data portal, not limited to specific dataset types. Design with flexibility and user convenience in mind.

  • Always after finishing important tasks, stage and commit changes
  • Always test your new additions to make sure they work
